hero.title: Founding Engineer at Welup Digital
hero.overview: As the founding engineer and first developer hire, I co-developed the initial platform before leading the sole transition to a modern Next.js architecture. I managed everything from the scalable Sanity CMS implementation to technical SEO, while also mentoring the next generation of talent as an instructor at Welup Academy.

challenge.problem: Welup Digital’s original site was static HTML/CSS/JS, limiting SEO, scalability, and content management. The business needed a modern, dynamic platform to support growth, content, and client delivery, while also withstanding DDoS attacks.
constraints: Solo developer for rewrite and CMS
challenge.context: As Welup Digital grew, the need for a scalable, SEO-first, and content-driven platform became critical for both the agency and its clients.
metrics: Static site: no CMS, poor SEO
No blog or landing page system

primary: Migrate to Next.js for performance and SEO
Build a CMS for blogs and landing pages
success: CMS launched for blogs and landing pages
Top 5 SEO rankings for key terms
Multiple client sites delivered and optimized

approach.methodology: Incremental migration and feature delivery, focusing on performance, SEO, and content flexibility.

phases.name: CMS & Content
activities: Developing blog and landing page system

phases.name: SEO & Academy Instruction
activities: Teaching web development and SEO at Welup Academy

keyDecisions.decision: Migrated to Next.js and server components

keyDecisions.rationale: Mitigated DDoS attacks and ensured uptime

research: Benchmarked SEO and performance against top digital agencies
Analyzed user feedback for navigation and speed
approach.collaboration: Joined as the first hire and founding engineer. Co-developed the initial version with another teammate before taking sole ownership of the Next.js rewrite and full technical stack.
iterations: Refining CMS and UX based on analytics and feedback
approach.userFeedback: The founders and academy students praise the new platform for its speed, clarity, and robust SEO foundations.

metrics: CMS for blogs and landing pages

testimonials.name: Adaeze Nwosu
testimonials.quote: Andy is leading our web platform’s transformation—our new CMS and site are fast, reliable, and easy for the whole team. Our SEO and client delivery have never been stronger.

achievements: Major SEO and client delivery wins
Built foundational CMS and content systems

hero.title: SEO Growth for PromptEarn
hero.overview: During my 6 months at PromptEarn, I led SEO and affiliate growth, achieving a 250% increase in organic traffic and top 5 keyword rankings through technical SEO, Core Web Vitals optimization, and affiliate network expansion.

challenge.problem: PromptEarn needed to boost organic traffic and affiliate-driven sales in a competitive market. The site suffered from slow load times, suboptimal SEO, and a stagnant affiliate network.
challenge.context: Affiliate marketing and SEO are highly competitive in the Nigerian fintech space. PromptEarn aimed to outpace rivals by improving technical SEO and expanding its affiliate network.

primary: Achieve top 5 rankings for target keywords
stakeholder: Increased sales from organic and referral channels
success: Top search visibility for core fintech terms

approach.methodology: Agile, data-driven SEO and affiliate marketing with weekly sprints and continuous measurement.

keyDecisions.rationale: Improved rankings and reduced bounce rate

research: User feedback on site speed and navigation
approach.collaboration: Weekly syncs with marketing and dev teams, monthly reviews with stakeholders.
iterations: Refined landing pages based on bounce rate data
approach.userFeedback: Affiliate partners and users reported improved site speed and easier navigation.

metrics: Top 1% search visibility for niche keywords
achievements: Dominant search presence for target keywords
